page.title: 05HOUSING 2
page.content: In Longborough most of the oldest property some dating back to the 17th. century lies in the centre & southern end of the village.Evidence of former uses of property is visible by the names on some of them ie. The Old Forge, The Old Bakery & The Old Shop.Barn conversions have become fashionable in recent years & the former dairy at Banks Fee & the farm buildings in the centre have now been converted into mainly 1 & 2 bedroomed properties. The Old Rectory has been converted into separate apartments.New developments are in progress at the rear of the Old Rectory & at Old Orchard Court. Every year the village competes in the best kept village competition 'The Bledisloe Cup'.It nomally comes runner uo in its class.
